attributes.name: SyncToken
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL Description: Version number of the entity. The SyncToken is used to lock the entity for use by one application at a time. As soon as an application modifies an entity, its SyncToken is incremented; another application's request to modify the entity with the same SyncToken will fail. Only the latest version of the entity is maintained by Data Services. An attempt to modify an entity specifying an older SyncToken will fail.
Required for the update operation. Required: ALL

attributes.name: Number
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: Credit Card account number, as printed on the card. Must not have whitespace or formatting characters.

attributes.name: Type
attributes.synopsis: Product: ALL Description: Type of credit card.

attributes.name: NameOnAcct
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: Account holder name, as printed on the card.

attributes.name: CcExpiryMonth
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: Expiration Month on card, expressed as a number: 1 = January, 2 = February, etc.

attributes.name: CcExpiryYear
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: Expiration Year on card, expressed as a 4 digit number 1999, 2003, etc.

attributes.name: BillAddrStreet
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: Credit card holder billing address of record: the street address to which credit card statements are sent.

attributes.name: PostalCode
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: Credit card holder billing postal code. Five digits in the USA.

attributes.name: CommercialCardCode
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: Code associated with commercial cards: purchase, corporate, and business cards. Lower transaction fee rates apply when these cards are used and this field is provided.

attributes.name: CCTxnMode
attributes.synopsis: Product: ALL Description: Credit card transaction mode used in Credit Card payment transactions. Valid values: CardNotPresent (default) or CardPresent.

attributes.name: CCTxnType
attributes.synopsis: Product: ALL Description: Type of credit card transaction. Valid values: Authorization, Capture, Charge, Refund, VoiceAuthorization.

attributes.name: PrevCCTransId
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: Unique identifier of the previous payment transaction. It can be used as an input to the Capture transaction type.

attributes.name: CreditCardChargeInfoEx
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: Internal use only: extension place holder for CreditCardChargeInfo

attributes.name: CCProcessor
attributes.synopsis:
Product: Not used now
						Description: Credit Card Processor Name for recording the payment processor

attributes.name: CCTransId
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: Unique identifier of the payment transaction. It can be used to track the status of transactions, or to search transactions.

attributes.name: Status
attributes.synopsis: Product: ALL Description: Indicates the status of the payment transaction. Possible values include Completed, Unknown.

attributes.name: ResultCode
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: Numeric code specifying the result of the transaction.

attributes.name: ResultMsg
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: Text specifying the result of the transaction.

attributes.name: MerchantAcctNum
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: Merchant account number associated with the credit card transaction.

attributes.name: CardSecurityCodeMatch
attributes.synopsis: Product: ALL Description: Result of comparing the security code supplied in the credit card transaction request with the code on file with the card issuer. Possible values are Pass, Fail, and NotAvailable.

attributes.name: AuthCode
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: Code returned from the credit card processor to indicate that the charge will be paid by the card issuer.

attributes.name: AvsStreet
attributes.synopsis: Product: ALL Description: The AVS (Address Verification Service) result for the street address supplied in the transaction. Possible values are Pass, if the information matches the information on file with the cardholder's account, Fail, or NotAvailable.

attributes.name: AvsZip
attributes.synopsis: The AVS (Address Verification Service) result for the zip code supplied in the transaction.  Possible values are Pass, if the information matches the information on file with the cardholder's account, Fail, or NotAvailable.

attributes.name: SecurityCode
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: CardCode or Card Id field that can be optionally provided to use additional security features of credit card authorization. It is typically a 3 digit number located on the back of most credit cards. For American Express, it is a 4 digit number on the front.

attributes.name: ReconBatchId
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: Indicates which deposit batch the transaction belongs to. Allows for integration with Intuit MAS Service and QBFS: enables reconciliation between what is charged on credit card and what is already deposited into bank.

attributes.name: PaymentGroupingCode
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: Code that indicates membership in a group of card types that are normally deposited together.

attributes.name: TxnAuthorizationTime
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: Timestamp indicating the time in which the card processor authorized the transaction.

attributes.name: TxnAuthorizationStamp
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: This value is used to support the credit card transaction reconciliation.

attributes.name: ClientTransID
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: An identifier returned in settlement data used to support the credit card transaction reconciliation.

attributes.name: CreditChargeResponseEx
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: Internal use only: extension place holder for CreditChargeResponse

attributes.name: DocNumber
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBO Description: Reference number for the transaction. If DocNumber is not provided, and the Custom Transaction Number is set to "Off", QBO assigns a document number using the next-in-sequence algorithm for Sales transactions. Product: ALL Description: Details of taxes charged on the transaction as a whole. attributes.synopsis:
User recognizable name for the Fixed Asset Item.
Length Restriction: QBO: 15 QBW: 1024

attributes.name: Active
attributes.synopsis: Whether or not active inactive fixed assets may be hidden from most display purposes and may not be used on financial transactions.

attributes.name: AcquiredAs
attributes.synopsis:
Specifies whether the asset is new or used. This will aid in calculating depreciation.
Length Restriction: QBO: 15 QBW: 1024

attributes.name: PurchaseDesc
attributes.synopsis: User entered purchase description for the fixed asset which may include user entered information to further describe the details of the purchase.

attributes.name: PurchaseDate
attributes.synopsis:
Specifies the date the asset was purchased or acquired.
Length Restriction: QBO: 15 QBW: 1024

attributes.name: PurchaseCost
attributes.synopsis: Specifies the asset's purchase price.

attributes.name: Vendor
attributes.synopsis: Specifies the name of the vendor or payee from whom the asset was purchased.

attributes.name: AssetAccountRef
attributes.synopsis:
Indicates the Fixed Asset account that tracks the current value of the asset. If the same account is used for all fixed assets, the current balance of this account will represent the current total value of the fixed assets.

Required for the create operation.

attributes.name: SalesDesc
attributes.synopsis: User entered sales description for the fixed asset which may include user entered information to further describe the details of the sales.

attributes.name: SalesDate
attributes.synopsis: Specifies the date the asset was sold.

attributes.name: SalesPrice
attributes.synopsis: Specifies the amount for which the asset was sold.

attributes.name: SalesExpense
attributes.synopsis: Additional expenses incurred during the sale of the asset.

attributes.name: Location
attributes.synopsis: Information about where the asset is located or has been placed into service.

attributes.name: PONumber
attributes.synopsis: The purchase order number if a purchase order was used to buy the asset.

attributes.name: SerialNumber
attributes.synopsis: The serial number of the asset. For a vehicle, it can be the VIN.

attributes.name: WarrantyExpDate
attributes.synopsis: The date the warranty for the asset expires.

attributes.name: Description
attributes.synopsis: Any description of the asset, like maker, brand, and so on.

attributes.name: Notes
attributes.synopsis: Notes about the asset that might help to track it properly, such as notes about repairs or upkeep.

attributes.name: AssetNum
attributes.synopsis: QBW only: asset number. Maintained by the QB Fixed Asset Manager.

attributes.name: CostBasis
attributes.synopsis: QBW only: The total cost of the fixed asset. This can include the cost of improvements or repairs. This amount is used to calculate depreciation. Maintained by the QB Fixed Asset Manager.

attributes.name: Depreciation
attributes.synopsis: QBW only: the total amount of depreciation expense since the fixed asset was acquired as of the end of the year. Maintained by the QB Fixed Asset Manager.

attributes.name: BookValue
attributes.synopsis: QBW only: the asset's cost or basis less accumulated depreciation as of the end of the year. Maintained by the QB Fixed Asset Manager.

attributes.synopsis: Internal use only: extension place holder for FixedAsset

attributes.name: TaxRateRef
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBW Description: Reference to a TaxRate. For all editions of QuickBooks, for TaxLineDetail line types that apply a specific TaxRate to the preceding line of the transaction, this is a reference to that TaxRate. For a TaxLineDetail in a TxnTaxDetail, where the TxnTaxCodeRef is set, the TaxRate referenced here MUST also be one of the rates in the referenced tax code's rate list (either the SalesTaxRateList or the PurchaseTaxRateList) that applies to the transaction type.
For international editions of QuickBooks, for a TaxLineDetail in a TxnTaxDetail, the rate referenced here must be referenced by a TaxCode used on a transaction line. Any given rate may only be listed once.
See Global Tax Model. Product: QBO Description: For US editions of QuickBooks Online, and in TxnTaxDetail only, this references the TaxRate applied to the entire transaction.
For international editions of QuickBooks Online, for a TaxLineDetail in a TxnTaxDetail, where the TxnTaxCodeRef is set, the TaxRate referenced here MUST also be one of the rates in the referenced tax code's rate list (either the SalesTaxRateList or the PurchaseTaxRateList) that applies to the transaction type. Any given rate may only be listed once.
Does not apply to a TaxLineDetail apart from a TxnTaxDetail.
See Global Tax Model.

attributes.name: PriceLevelRef

Product: ALL
						Description: Reference to a PriceLevel for the markup.

Required for the update operation. Required: ALL

attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: Descriptive information about the entity.  The MetaData values are set by Data Services and are read only for all applications.

Product: QBW
						Description: Custom field (or data extension).
						Filterable: QBW

attributes.name: HasAttachment
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBO
						Specifies if the entity has attachment, default is false or null

attributes.name: Name
attributes.synopsis:
User recognizable name for the Account.
Length Restriction: QBO: 100 characters QBW: 1024

attributes.name: SubAccount
attributes.synopsis: Specifies the Account is a SubAccount or Not. True if subaccount, false or null if it is top-level account

attributes.name: ParentRef
attributes.synopsis: Specifies the Parent AccountId if this represents a SubAccount. Else null or empty

attributes.name: Description
attributes.synopsis:
User entered description for the account, which may include user entered information to guide bookkeepers/accountants in deciding what journal entries to post to the account.
								Length Restriction:
								QBO: 100 characters
								QBW: 1024

attributes.name: FullyQualifiedName
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL Description: Output Only. Fully qualified name of the entity. The fully qualified name prepends the topmost parent, followed by each sub element separated by colons. Takes the form of:
Parent:Account1:SubAccount1:SubAccount2

attributes.name: Active
attributes.synopsis: Whether or not active inactive accounts may be hidden from most display purposes and may not be posted to.

attributes.name: Classification
attributes.synopsis: Optional. 5 types of classification an account classified.  Suggested examples of account type are Asset, Equity, Expense, Liability, Revenue

attributes.name: AccountType
attributes.synopsis: Required. Type is a detailed account classification that specifies the use of this account. 16 type of account subtypes available in AccountTypeEnum

attributes.name: AccountSubType
attributes.synopsis:
Supported by QBO only. AccountSubTypeEnum specificies QBO on detail type. 
								If not specified default value are listed for each SubType

attributes.name: AcctNum
attributes.synopsis:
User entered/specified account number to help the user in identifying the account within the chart-of-accounts and in  deciding what should be posted to the account.  Examples of numbering accounts:
								1000s: Assets
								2000s: Liabilities
								3000s: Equity
								4000s: Income
								5000s: Cost of Sales
								6000s, 7000s: Other operating expenses
								8000s: Other income
								9000s: Other expenses

attributes.name: BankNum
attributes.synopsis:
Bank Account Number, should include routing number whatever else depending upon the context, this may be the credit card number or the checking account number, etc.
								Not supported by QBO
								Length Restriction:
								QBW: 1024

attributes.name: OpeningBalance
attributes.synopsis: Specifies the Opening Balance amount when creating a new Balance Sheet account.

attributes.name: OpeningBalanceDate
attributes.synopsis: Specifies the Date of the Opening Balance amount when creating a new Balance Sheet account.

attributes.name: CurrentBalance
attributes.synopsis:
Specifies the balance amount for the current Account. Valid for Balance Sheet accounts. QuickBooks Notes
Non QB-writable.

attributes.name: CurrentBalanceWithSubAccounts
attributes.synopsis:
Specifies the cumulative balance amount for the current Account and all its sub-accounts. QuickBooks Notes
Non QB-writable.

attributes.name: CurrencyRef
attributes.synopsis: Reference to the Currency that this account will hold the amounts in.

attributes.name: TaxAccount
attributes.synopsis: Describes if the account is taxable

attributes.name: TaxCodeRef
attributes.synopsis: If the account is taxable, refers to taxcode reference if applicable

attributes.name: AccountEx
attributes.synopsis: Internal use only: extension place holder for Account.

attributes.name: Credit
attributes.synopsis: If false or null it represents a CreditCard charge expense, true represent Credit (money-in or returned)

attributes.name: PayeeAddr
attributes.synopsis: Address to which the payment should be sent.

attributes.name: MemoOnCheck
attributes.synopsis: In case of check expense, MemoOnCheck represent the data written on the check as message written to the Payee to physically read on the check

attributes.name: PrintStatus
attributes.synopsis: ReadToPrint is a flag indicating if the Check is ready for printing

attributes.name: CheckNum
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: The check number printed on the check.

attributes.name: Status
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: Status of the check. Values provided by service/business logic.

attributes.name: NameOnAcct
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: Name of persons or entities holding the account, as printed on the check.

attributes.name: AcctNum
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: Checking account number, as printed on the check.

attributes.name: BankName
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: The name of the bank on which the check was drawn.

attributes.name: HasAttachment
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBO
						Specifies if the entity has attachment, default is false or null

attributes.name: DocNumber
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBO Description: Reference number for the transaction. If DocNumber is not provided, and the Custom Transaction Number is set to "Off", QBO assigns a document number using the next-in-sequence algorithm for Sales transactions. Otherwise the value will remaing null. Alternatively, you can also pass in "AUTO_GENERATE" in this field to force QBO to auto-sequence the document number for Invoices, Estimates and Sales Receipt.
The maximum length for DocNumber is 21 characters. The default value is an empty String. Filter support not provided for Payment. Product: QBW Description: The primary document number for this transaction. DocNumber is exposed to end users.
If it is not provided, QuickBooks business logic will assign the document number using the "next in sequence" algorithm.
Max. length is 11 characters for Payment, Bill, ItemReceipt and VendorCredit. Max. length is 20 characters for other entities. Filterable: QBO

attributes.name: TxnDate
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBO
								Description: The date entered by the user when this transaction occurred. Often, it is the date when the transaction is created in the system. For "posting" transactions, this is the posting date that affects the financial statements. If the date is not supplied, the current date on the server is used.
								Product: QBW
								Description: The nominal, user entered, date of the transaction.  Often, but not required to be, the date the transaction was created in the system. For "posting" transactions, this is the posting date that affects financial statements.
								Filterable: ALL
								Sortable: QBO

attributes.name: DepartmentRef
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBO
								Description: Location of the transaction, as defined using location tracking in QuickBooks Online.

attributes.name: CurrencyRef
attributes.synopsis: Product: ALL Description: Reference to the Currency in which all amounts on the associated transaction are expressed.

attributes.name: ExchangeRate
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
								Description: Currency exchange rate. Valid only if the company file is set up to use Multi-Currency feature. In QuickBooks, exchange rates are always recorded as the number of home currency units it takes to equal one foreign currency unit. The foreign unit is always 1 and the amount of home units that equal that 1 foreign unit is what QuickBooks uses as the exchange rate.

attributes.name: PrivateNote
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
								Description: User entered, organization-private note about the transaction. This note will not appear on the transaction records by default.

attributes.name: TxnStatus
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBW Description: The status of the transaction. Depending on the transaction type it may have different values.
For Sales Transactions acceptable values are defined in PaymentStatusEnum. For Estimate, the values accepted are defined in EstimateStatusEnum. Product: QBO Description: The status of the transaction. Depending on the transaction type it may have different values.
For Sales Transactions acceptable values are defined in PaymentStatusEnum. For Estimate, the values accepted are defined in QboEstimateStatusEnum.

attributes.name: LinkedTxn
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
								Description: A linked (related) transaction.  More than one transaction can be linked.

attributes.name: Line
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBW
								Description: A line item of a transaction.
								Product: QBO
								Description: A line item of a transaction. QuickBooks Online does not support tax lines in the main transaction body, only in the TxnTaxDetail section.

attributes.name: TxnTaxDetail
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL Description: Details of taxes charged on the transaction as a whole. For US versions of QuickBooks, tax rates used in the detail section must not be used in any tax line appearing in the main transaction body. For international versions of QuickBooks, the TxnTaxDetail should provide the details of all taxes (sales or purchase) calculated for the transaction based on the tax codes referenced by the transaction. This can be calculated by QuickBooks business logic or you may supply it when adding a transaction. For US versions of QuickBooks you need only supply the tax code for the customer and the tax code (in the case of multiple rates) or tax rate (for a single rate) to apply for the transaction as a whole.
See Global Tax Model.

attributes.name: AccountRef
attributes.synopsis: Specifies the account reference. Check should have bank account, CreditCard should specify credit card account

attributes.name: PaymentMethodRef
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
								Description: Reference to the PaymentMethod.

attributes.name: PaymentRefNum
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
								Description: The reference number for the payment received (I.e. Check # for a check, envelope # for a cash donation, CreditCardTransactionID for a credit card payment)

attributes.name: PaymentType
attributes.synopsis:
Required element. No defaults. Expense Type can be Cash, Check or CreditCard
								Cash based expense is not supported by QBW.

attributes.name: EntityRef
attributes.synopsis: Specifies the party to whom a expense is associated with. Can be Customer, Vendor, Employee (or OtherName in case of QBW)

attributes.name: Credit
attributes.synopsis: If Credit is Null or False, it is considered as Charge. If true, the CreditCard represents a Refund. Valid only for CreditCard transaction

attributes.name: RemitToAddr
attributes.synopsis: Address to which the payment should be sent.Output only.

attributes.name: TotalAmt
attributes.synopsis:
The total amount due, determined by taking the sum of all lines associated. This includes all charges, allowances, taxes, discounts, etc... QuickBooks Notes
Non QB-writable. Output only field in case of QBO

attributes.name: TxnId
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL

attributes.name: TxnNum
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL

attributes.name: Memo
attributes.synopsis: Memo that will be printed in check in case of Check purchase, Memo appears on the expense report for CreditCard, Memo for CashPurchase

attributes.name: PrintStatus
attributes.synopsis: PrintStatus if to be printed or already printed information

attributes.name: TxnTaxDetail

Product: ALL Description: Details of taxes charged on the transaction as a whole. If not specified, the Undeposited Funds account will be used. Applicable to the Payment item type only.

attributes.name: SalesTaxCodeRef
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL Description: Reference to the sales tax code for the item.
Applicable to the Service, Other Charge, Part (Non-Inventory), Inventory and Assembly item types only.

attributes.name: PurchaseTaxCodeRef
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL Description: Reference to the purchase tax code for the item.
Applicable to the Service, Other Charge, and Part (Non-Inventory) item types.

attributes.name: InvStartDate
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL Description: Date of the opening balance for the inventory transaction. QuickBooks creates the Opening Balance inventory transaction as of the given date, and calculates the total value by multiplying the cost by the quantity on hand.
Applies to the Quantity On Hand and Total Value.
Applicable to the Inventory and Assembly item types only.

attributes.name: BuildPoint
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL Description: Assembly item QuantityOnHand threshold below which more assemblies should be built.
Applicable to the Assembly Item type only.
When he quantity of the assembly item gets below the BuildPoint number, QuickBooks will remind the user to build more.

attributes.name: PrintGroupedItems
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBW
				                Description: Lets us know if the user wants to display the subitems as a group.  Applicable to items of Group type only.

attributes.name: SpecialItem
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
								Description: True if this is a special item used by QuickBooks in certain accounting functions, including miscellaneous charges that do not fall into the categories of service, labor, materials, or parts. Examples include delivery charges, setup fees, and service charges.

attributes.name: SpecialItemType
attributes.synopsis: Product: ALL Description Type of special item, if SpecialItem is true.

attributes.name: ItemGroupDetail
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL

attributes.name: ItemAssemblyDetail
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
								Description: Contains the detailed inventory parts used when the assembly is built. Applicable to an inventory assembly item only.

attributes.synopsis: Internal use only: extension place holder for Item

attributes.name: DiscountPercent
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBW
								Description: Discount percentage available against an amount if paid within the discount window specified for the term. 
								Product: QBO
								Description: Discount percentage available against an amount if paid within the discount window specified for the term. This value is used only when DueDays is specified.

attributes.name: DueDays
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBW
										Description: Number of days from delivery of goods or services until the payment is due.
										Product: QBO
										Description: Number of days from delivery of goods or services until the payment is due. If DueDays is specified, only DiscountDays and DiscountPercent can be additionally specified.
										Required: QBO

attributes.name: DiscountDays
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBW
										Description: Discount applies if paid within this number of days.
										Product: QBO
										Description: Number of days for which the discount is applicable, if the payment is made within these days. This value is used only when DueDays is specified.

attributes.name: DayOfMonthDue
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBW Description: Payment must be received by this day of the month.
Required for the Create request. Product: QBO Description: Payment must be received by this day of the month. This value is used only when DueDays is not specified.
Required for the Create request.

attributes.name: DueNextMonthDays
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBW
										Description: Payment due next month if issued that many days before the DayOfMonthDue.
										Product: QBO
										Description: Payment due next month if issued that many days before the DayOfMonthDue. This value is used only when DueDays is not specified.

attributes.name: DiscountDayOfMonth
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBW
										Description: Discount applies if paid before this day of month.
										Product: QBO
										Description: Discount applies if paid before this day of month. This value is used only when DueDays is not specified.

attributes.name: DocNumber
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBO Description: Reference number for the transaction. If DocNumber is not provided, and the Custom Transaction Number is set to "Off", QBO assigns a document number using the next-in-sequence algorithm for Sales transactions. Otherwise the value will remaing null. Alternatively, you can also pass in "AUTO_GENERATE" in this field to force QBO to auto-sequence the document number for Invoices, Estimates and Sales Receipt.
The maximum length for DocNumber is 21 characters. The default value is an empty String. Filter support not provided for Payment. Product: QBW Description: The primary document number for this transaction. DocNumber is exposed to end users.
If it is not provided, QuickBooks business logic will assign the document number using the "next in sequence" algorithm.
Max. length is 11 characters for Payment, Bill, ItemReceipt and VendorCredit. Max. length is 20 characters for other entities. Filterable: QBO

attributes.name: TxnDate
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBO
								Description: The date entered by the user when this transaction occurred. Often, it is the date when the transaction is created in the system. For "posting" transactions, this is the posting date that affects the financial statements. If the date is not supplied, the current date on the server is used.
								Product: QBW
								Description: The nominal, user entered, date of the transaction.  Often, but not required to be, the date the transaction was created in the system. For "posting" transactions, this is the posting date that affects financial statements.
								Filterable: ALL
								Sortable: QBO

attributes.synopsis:

attributes.name: CurrencyRef
attributes.synopsis: Product: ALL Description: Reference to the Currency in which all amounts on the associated transaction are expressed.

attributes.name: ExchangeRate
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
								Description: Currency exchange rate. Valid only if the company file is set up to use Multi-Currency feature. In QuickBooks, exchange rates are always recorded as the number of home currency units it takes to equal one foreign currency unit. The foreign unit is always 1 and the amount of home units that equal that 1 foreign unit is what QuickBooks uses as the exchange rate.

attributes.name: PrivateNote
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
								Description: User entered, organization-private note about the transaction. This note will not appear on the transaction records by default.

attributes.name: TxnStatus
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBW Description: The status of the transaction. Depending on the transaction type it may have different values.
For Sales Transactions acceptable values are defined in PaymentStatusEnum. For Estimate, the values accepted are defined in EstimateStatusEnum. Product: QBO Description: The status of the transaction. Depending on the transaction type it may have different values.
For Sales Transactions acceptable values are defined in PaymentStatusEnum. For Estimate, the values accepted are defined in QboEstimateStatusEnum.

attributes.name: Line
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBW
								Description: A line item of a transaction.
								Product: QBO
								Description: A line item of a transaction. QuickBooks Online does not support tax lines in the main transaction body, only in the TxnTaxDetail section.

attributes.name: TxnTaxDetail
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL Description: Details of taxes charged on the transaction as a whole. For US versions of QuickBooks, tax rates used in the detail section must not be used in any tax line appearing in the main transaction body. For international versions of QuickBooks, the TxnTaxDetail should provide the details of all taxes (sales or purchase) calculated for the transaction based on the tax codes referenced by the transaction. This can be calculated by QuickBooks business logic or you may supply it when adding a transaction. For US versions of QuickBooks you need only supply the tax code for the customer and the tax code (in the case of multiple rates) or tax rate (for a single rate) to apply for the transaction as a whole.
See Global Tax Model.

attributes.name: VendorRef
attributes.synopsis:
Identifies the party or organization that originated the purchase of the goods, services or BillPayment. QuickBooks Notes
Valid Vendor Name or Id is required for the create operation for Bill Payment transactions.
Required for the create operation.

attributes.name: APAccountRef
attributes.synopsis:
Optional AP account specification for bill payment transactions. Most small businesses have a single AP account, so the account is implied. When specified, the account must be a liability account - and further, must be of the sub-type "Payables". QuickBooks Notes
The AP Account should always be specified or a default will be used.

attributes.name: TotalAmt
attributes.synopsis:

Non QB-writable.

								Length Restriction:
								QBO: 15

attributes.synopsis: The entire transaction, or individual items are manually closed, i.e. they may not be received.

Product: ALL Description: Unique Identifier for an Intuit entity (object).
Required for the update operation. Required: ALL Filterable: ALL

attributes.name: SyncToken
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL Description: Version number of the entity. The SyncToken is used to lock the entity for use by one application at a time. As soon as an application modifies an entity, its SyncToken is incremented; another application's request to modify the entity with the same SyncToken will fail. Only the latest version of the entity is maintained by Data Services. An attempt to modify an entity specifying an older SyncToken will fail.
Required for the update operation. Required: ALL

attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
						Description: Descriptive information about the entity.  The MetaData values are set by Data Services and are read only for all applications.

Product: QBW
						Description: Custom field (or data extension).
						Filterable: QBW

attributes.name: HasAttachment
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBO
						Specifies if the entity has attachment, default is false or null

attributes.name: DocNumber
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBO Description: Reference number for the transaction. If DocNumber is not provided, and the Custom Transaction Number is set to "Off", QBO assigns a document number using the next-in-sequence algorithm for Sales transactions. Otherwise the value will remaing null. Alternatively, you can also pass in "AUTO_GENERATE" in this field to force QBO to auto-sequence the document number for Invoices, Estimates and Sales Receipt.
The maximum length for DocNumber is 21 characters. The default value is an empty String. Filter support not provided for Payment. Product: QBW Description: The primary document number for this transaction. DocNumber is exposed to end users.
If it is not provided, QuickBooks business logic will assign the document number using the "next in sequence" algorithm.
Max. length is 11 characters for Payment, Bill, ItemReceipt and VendorCredit. Max. length is 20 characters for other entities. Filterable: QBO

attributes.name: TxnDate
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBO
								Description: The date entered by the user when this transaction occurred. Often, it is the date when the transaction is created in the system. For "posting" transactions, this is the posting date that affects the financial statements. If the date is not supplied, the current date on the server is used.
								Product: QBW
								Description: The nominal, user entered, date of the transaction.  Often, but not required to be, the date the transaction was created in the system. For "posting" transactions, this is the posting date that affects financial statements.
								Filterable: ALL
								Sortable: QBO

attributes.name: DepartmentRef
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBO
								Description: Location of the transaction, as defined using location tracking in QuickBooks Online.

attributes.name: CurrencyRef
attributes.synopsis: Product: ALL Description: Reference to the Currency in which all amounts on the associated transaction are expressed.

attributes.name: ExchangeRate
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
								Description: Currency exchange rate. Valid only if the company file is set up to use Multi-Currency feature. In QuickBooks, exchange rates are always recorded as the number of home currency units it takes to equal one foreign currency unit. The foreign unit is always 1 and the amount of home units that equal that 1 foreign unit is what QuickBooks uses as the exchange rate.

attributes.name: PrivateNote
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
								Description: User entered, organization-private note about the transaction. This note will not appear on the transaction records by default.

attributes.name: TxnStatus
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBW Description: The status of the transaction. Depending on the transaction type it may have different values.
For Sales Transactions acceptable values are defined in PaymentStatusEnum. For Estimate, the values accepted are defined in EstimateStatusEnum. Product: QBO Description: The status of the transaction. Depending on the transaction type it may have different values.
For Sales Transactions acceptable values are defined in PaymentStatusEnum. For Estimate, the values accepted are defined in QboEstimateStatusEnum.

attributes.name: LinkedTxn
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
								Description: A linked (related) transaction.  More than one transaction can be linked.

attributes.name: Line
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBW
								Description: A line item of a transaction.
								Product: QBO
								Description: A line item of a transaction. QuickBooks Online does not support tax lines in the main transaction body, only in the TxnTaxDetail section.

attributes.name: TxnTaxDetail
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL Description: Details of taxes charged on the transaction as a whole. For US versions of QuickBooks, tax rates used in the detail section must not be used in any tax line appearing in the main transaction body. For international versions of QuickBooks, the TxnTaxDetail should provide the details of all taxes (sales or purchase) calculated for the transaction based on the tax codes referenced by the transaction. This can be calculated by QuickBooks business logic or you may supply it when adding a transaction. For US versions of QuickBooks you need only supply the tax code for the customer and the tax code (in the case of multiple rates) or tax rate (for a single rate) to apply for the transaction as a whole.
See Global Tax Model.

attributes.name: AutoDocNumber
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
								Description: If true, we will generate DocNumber automatically.  If false or null, the DocNumber is generated based on preference of the user.

attributes.name: CustomerRef
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
								Description: Reference to a Customer or job.

attributes.name: CustomerMemo
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBO Description: For an Invoice, this is the user-entered message to the customer that does appear in the invoice, and does appear in the printed invoice. The maximum length for Invoice Msg is 1000 characters.
For a Bill, this is the memo of the transaction to provide more detail, and does not appear in the printed message of the bill. The maximum length for Bill Msg is 4000 characters.
For a CreditCardCharge, this message appears in the printed record; maximum length is 4000 characters.
Not supported for BillPayment, JournalEntry or Payment. Product: QBW Description: User-entered message to the customer; this message will be visible to end user on their transactions.
Cannot be written to QuickBooks.

attributes.name: BillAddr

Product: QBO Description: Bill-to address of the Invoice.

See Addresses

attributes.name: ApplyTaxAfterDiscount
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL

attributes.name: BillEmail
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBO Description: Identifies the e-mail address where the invoice is sent. At present, you can provide only one e-mail address.
If the ToBeEmailed attribute is true and the BillEmail attribute contains an e-mail address, the user can send an e-mail message to the e-mail address that is specified in the BillEmail attribute.
If the BillEmail attribute contains an invalid e-mail address, QBO does not send the e-mail message to the invalid e-mail address. QBO also does not return any error message to indicate that the e-mail address is invalid.
The maximum length for BillEmail is 100 characters. Product: QBW Description: Identifies the email address where the bill or invoice is sent.
UNSUPPORTED FIELD.

attributes.name: ExchangeRate
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL
								Description: Currency exchange rate. Valid only if the company file is set up to use Multi-Currency feature. In QuickBooks, exchange rates are always recorded as the number of home currency units it takes to equal one foreign currency unit. The foreign unit is always 1 and the amount of home units that equal that 1 foreign unit is what QuickBooks uses as the exchange rate.

For Sales Transactions acceptable values are defined in PaymentStatusEnum. For Estimate, the values accepted are defined in EstimateStatusEnum. Product: QBO Description: The status of the transaction. Depending on the transaction type it may have different values.
For Sales Transactions acceptable values are defined in PaymentStatusEnum. For Estimate, the values accepted are defined in QboEstimateStatusEnum.

attributes.name: LinkedTxn

Product: ALL

attributes.name: Line
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBW
								Description: A line item of a transaction.
								Product: QBO
								Description: A line item of a transaction. QuickBooks Online does not support tax lines in the main transaction body, only in the TxnTaxDetail section.

attributes.name: TxnTaxDetail
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL Description: Details of taxes charged on the transaction as a whole. For US versions of QuickBooks, tax rates used in the detail section must not be used in any tax line appearing in the main transaction body. For international versions of QuickBooks, the TxnTaxDetail should provide the details of all taxes (sales or purchase) calculated for the transaction based on the tax codes referenced by the transaction. This can be calculated by QuickBooks business logic or you may supply it when adding a transaction. For US versions of QuickBooks you need only supply the tax code for the customer and the tax code (in the case of multiple rates) or tax rate (for a single rate) to apply for the transaction as a whole.
See Global Tax Model.

attributes.name: CustomerMemo
attributes.synopsis:
Product: QBO Description: For an Invoice, this is the user-entered message to the customer that does appear in the invoice, and does appear in the printed invoice. The maximum length for Invoice Msg is 1000 characters.
For a Bill, this is the memo of the transaction to provide more detail, and does not appear in the printed message of the bill. The maximum length for Bill Msg is 4000 characters.
For a CreditCardCharge, this message appears in the printed record; maximum length is 4000 characters.
Not supported for BillPayment, JournalEntry or Payment. Product: QBW Description: User-entered message to the customer; this message will be visible to end user on their transactions.
Cannot be written to QuickBooks.

If the BillEmail attribute contains an invalid e-mail address, QBO does not send the e-mail message to the invalid e-mail address. QBO also does not return any error message to indicate that the e-mail address is invalid.

attributes.name: SyncToken
attributes.synopsis:
Product: ALL Description: Version number of the entity. The SyncToken is used to lock the entity for use by one application at a time. As soon as an application modifies an entity, its SyncToken is incremented; another application's request to modify the entity with the same SyncToken will fail. Only the latest version of the entity is maintained by Data Services. An attempt to modify an entity specifying an older SyncToken will fail.
